data.title: Photos: 2019 Honors & Awards Ceremony celebrates academic and leadership contributions

Congratulations to the 2019 honorees, who were recognized at the March 25th ceremony: Valine Music Prize – Samantha Foster Instrumentalist of the Year Award in memory of Jack Strouss, Jr. ’51 – Max Wagner […]
data.text:
Oglethorpe’s annual Honors and Awards Ceremony celebrates the academic and leadership contributions of students, faculty, and staff throughout the academic year.

Congratulations to the 2019 honorees, who were recognized at the March 25th ceremony:

Valine Music Prize – Samantha Foster

Instrumentalist of the Year Award in memory of Jack Strouss, Jr. ’51 – Max Wagner

Male Oglethorpe University Singer of the Year – Jake Van Valkenburg

Female Oglethorpe University Singer of the Year – Gillian Rabin

Core Teaching Award – Dr. Jay Lutz

Core Instructor Award – Dr. Linda DeCamp

Leo Bilancio Award – Alex Mead

The LeConte Award – Sindy Chavez

Rich Foundation Urban Leader in Action Award – Miracle Jackson

Margaret Floy Washburn Award – Rebecca Highsmith

Mary Whiton Calkins Award – Charlotte Disley

Outstanding Senior in Communication Studies – Gillian Rabin

Outstanding Senior in Communication Studies – Ciara Laughlin

Outstanding Traditional Undergraduate Senior Business Major – Armin Fakhrai

Outstanding Adult Degree Program Senior Business Major – James Myles

Outstanding Senior Human Resource Management Major – Megan Keck

Outstanding Economics Major – Mason Rodericks

Hetherington Shropshire Award – Jacquelyn Hinton

Anne Rivers Siddons Prize for Short Fiction – Kaitlyn Turner

Sidney Lanier Prize for Poetry – Ryan Holtzen

Outstanding Improvement in French Studies – Kirstin Grace Dent

Ronald Carlisle Prize in Mathematics and Computer Science – Robert Dougherty- Bliss

Ronald Carlisle Prize in Mathematics and Computer Science – Agbolade “Patrick” Akande

J. Frederick Agel, Sr. ’52 Endowed Scholarship – Samuel Held

J. Frederick Agel, Sr. ’52 Endowed Scholarship – Linda “McKenzie” Simpson

Compass Student of the Year – Justin Bennett

Compass Student of the Year – Courtney Davis

Adult Degree Program Student Award – Adrian Ranson

A_LAB Award – Deon Heavens

Omicron Delta Kappa Emerging Leadership Award – Talia Weinstein

Omicron Delta Kappa Outstanding Leadership Award – Dylan Harper

Omicron Delta Kappa Outstanding Staff Member Award – Jessica Winestock

Omicron Delta Kappa Outstanding Faculty Member Award – Dr. Matthew Wild

Spirit of Alpha Phi Omega – Deon Heavens

Spirit of Alpha Phi Omega – Dr. John Carton

Spirit of Alpha Phi Omega – Turhan Dantzler

Charles M. MacConnell Award – Arman Niknafs

Donald C. Agnew Award – Dr. John S. Carton

Student Government Association Community Appreciation Award – Turhan Dantzler

Keith Baker Endowed Award – Samuel Held

Dean’s Award for Outstanding Achievement by a Student Organization – Oglethorpe South Asian Club / Yesha Nayee

The Mary Mildred Sullivan Award – Benna Curole

The Algernon Sydney Sullivan Award – Bradley Firchow

The Sullivan Awards are one of Oglethorpe’s top honors given to two graduating seniors annually. For more than 125 years, the Sullivan Awards have honored those who put service above self. That spirit was the driving force in the lives of the Sullivans, and the awards recognize those who keep that spirit alive today.

Sullivan Awards are highly prized and have been won by people whose lives of service have changed the world with little fanfare, as well as those who have become household names. Recipients include First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt, television icon Fred Rogers, and Supreme Court Justice Lewis Powell.

Dr. Glenn Sharfman, provost and vice president for academic affairs, also recognized all students who were named to the Fall 2018 Dean’s List:

Oglethorpe University announces fall 2018 Dean’s List

Congratulations to those Oglethorpe students whose academic performance during the 2018 fall semester merited recognition on the Dean’s Academic Honors List! This list celebrates the 364 students who achieved at least a 3.50 term grade-point average, while earning 12 or more semester hours.
